result.execSummary:
The defendant Gabriel E Lafferty was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Possession of THC, an unclassified misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(3g)(e).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

of Right to Seek Postconviction Relief filed by defendant/counsel

3:05 P.M., Defendant Gabriel E Lafferty in court with attorney Amanda K. Riek.  Crystal N Long appeared for the State of Wisconsin. State objects to expunction, defendant has new law violations, Atty Riek requesting defendant receiving expunction, Court sentences defendant to: Ct. 1, $673.50 fine/costs, has been paid in full, defendant to submit DNA Sample, Court will not allow expunction, 3:22 P.M.
Sentencing hearing on January 13, 2017 at 03:00 pm.
from Atty Riek requesting a reset for the 12/28/16 Sentencing Hearing to a separate date/time - by fax
Filed by Atty Amanda Riek.

Defendant Gabriel E Lafferty in court with attorney Amanda K. Riek.  Jane E. Kohlwey appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant plead no contest to count one. Court found defendant guilty, sentence withheld for six months. Defendant to return to court in six months for expungement option. Fine of $673.50 to be entered at that time and defendant be found eligible for expungement. DNA sample to be submitted.  Sentencing hearing scheduled for December 28, 2016 at 02:45 pm.
Plea/sentencing hearing on June 29, 2016 at 02:45 pm.
Filed by Atty Amanda Riek, Matter is resolved, requesting a plea hearing the week of 6-13 or 6-20.

Defendant, Gabriel E Lafferty, appeared. Clifford Chase Burdon appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  $200.00 signature bond.  Not to possess any controlled substances without a valid Rx.  Standard misd. conditions.  Previously posted bond will be returned.  Pre-trial conference scheduled for February 10, 2016 at 02:50 pm.  Return date scheduled for March 11, 2016 at 02:45 pm.
